intro: Andrachne chinensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Chinese sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and succulent, hairy leaves. The plant typically thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, demonstrating adaptability to dry conditions. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. The hairy pubescence on its leaves and stems is a notable botanical feature that aids in reducing water loss.
